Class ec.ezlib.base.ArraySugar 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----ec.ezlib.base.ArraySugar
public class ArraySugar
extends Object
The EZ semantics of an array is an immutable Table whose keys are the integers from 0 thru size()-1. EZ arrays are immutable identity-free values. To distinguish this from the semantics of arrays in Java, in EZ we call them "tuples".

add(Object, Object)
Returns a new array that is the concatenation of this array with other.
containsKey(Object, Object)
The keys to an array are the integers from 0 thru size()-1
each(Object, AssocFunc)
Considered as a Table, an array is a mapping from indices to values, so each() will call func with each successive pair of index and value, in ascending index order.
elements(Object)
The resulting Enumeration will enumerate the elements of the array in ascending index order.
get(Object, int)
If the index is in bounds, return the corresponding element.
get(Object, Object, Object)
If the index is in bounds, return the corresponding element.
isIdentity(Object)
Considered as a Table, an array does not index based on identity.
keys(Object)
The resulting Enumeration will enumerate the integers from 0 thru size() -1.
keyType(Object)
The keys of an array must be integers
length(Object)
Array size() and length() are the same thing.
multiply(Object, int)
Returns the result of concatenating this 'reps' copies of this array.
size(Object)
Array size() and length() are the same thing.
slice(Object, int)
bound defaults to size()
slice(Object, int, int)
Returns a new array containing the part of this one from start thru bound-1.
toString(Object)
Arrays print using the EZ tuple syntax.
valueType(Object)
All the values in this array are of the returned type, but they may also be of a more specific type.

toString 
 public static String toString(Object rec)
Arrays print using the EZ tuple syntax. XXX Should the contained elements print according to EZ's toString() or Java's toString()? Currently they print using Java's toString(), but that seems wrong. However, fixing it in general (as opposed to just fixing arrays) would requiring sugaring all Java toString() messages that call other toString() messages.

size 
 public static int size(Object rec)
Array size() and length() are the same thing.

length 
 public static int length(Object rec)
Array size() and length() are the same thing.

containsKey 
 public static boolean containsKey(Object rec,
                                   Object key)
The keys to an array are the integers from 0 thru size()-1

get 
 public static Object get(Object rec,
                          int index) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
If the index is in bounds, return the corresponding element. Otherwise throw an IndexOutOfBoundsException

get 
 public static Object get(Object rec,
                          Object index,
                          Object instead)
If the index is in bounds, return the corresponding element. Otherwise return 'instead'.

keys 
 public static Enumeration keys(Object rec)
The resulting Enumeration will enumerate the integers from 0 thru size() -1.

elements 
 public static Enumeration elements(Object rec)
The resulting Enumeration will enumerate the elements of the array in ascending index order.

each 
 public static void each(Object rec,
                         AssocFunc func) throws Throwable
Considered as a Table, an array is a mapping from indices to values, so each() will call func with each successive pair of index and value, in ascending index order.

isIdentity 
 public static boolean isIdentity(Object rec)
Considered as a Table, an array does not index based on identity. XXX This is probably not a concept in EZ's semantics, in which case this method should be removed, and the corresponding Table method should be hidden.

keyType 
 public static Class keyType(Object rec)
The keys of an array must be integers

valueType 
 public static Class valueType(Object rec)
All the values in this array are of the returned type, but they may also be of a more specific type.

slice 
 public static Object slice(Object rec,
                            int start,
                            int bound) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
Returns a new array containing the part of this one from start thru bound-1.

slice 
 public static Object slice(Object rec,
                            int start) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
bound defaults to size()

add 
 public static Object add(Object rec,
                          Object other)
Returns a new array that is the concatenation of this array with other. other may be either an array or a Vector.

multiply 
 public static Object multiply(Object rec,
                               int reps)
Returns the result of concatenating this 'reps' copies of this array.
